description.p: As a bonus action you can enter a blood frenzy that lasts for 1 minute, reverting to your curse’s wild roots and getting down on all fours, dropping anything you are holding. While in this stance you gain 10 feet of movement and your running leap counts your strength score as triple, instead of double, for the purposes of performing a long jump. When performing your running leap for at least 20 feet, you may choose to target a creature you can see to perform one of the following attacks:

ul.li: Wolf’s Mark - Make a claw attack which will always be a critical on a hit, after this attack successfully hits you lose your stance.

Hunter’s Takedown - The creature must make a Strength (Athletics) check against your Strength (Athletics), Dexterity (Acrobatics) or Wisdom (Survival) check or go prone. After the creature fails you lose your stance.

description.p: You can enter this stance a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

description.p: As a bonus action, you may stomp your hoof into the ground causing all enemies on the ground within 5 feet of you to roll a Dexterity saving throw (DC = your Strength modifier + 10) or be dazed until the end of your next turn. You can perform this stomp a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus per long rest.

Some saphirs have such control over their powers that when their life seems to be about to end their will transforms them into a blood thirsty mist. Once per long rest, when you reach 0 hit points you transform into a vampiric mist instead until the end of your next turn. If while in this form you use it’s life drain attack to regain health, the resulting healing is given to your saphir form instead. While in vampiric mist form you cannot be healed by any other means other than by your life drain. If at the end of your turn you haven’t regained health, roll a death saving throw.

Your teeth become sharpened turning into a simple weapon with which you are proficient. You may add your Constituiton modifier instead of your Strength modifier, to the attack and damage rolls made with your teeth. On a hit, your bite deals 1d4 piercing damage and the target becomes infected for 1 minute. You have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Survival) check to find the infected creature.

If a creature dies whilst infected, and you are within 30 feet and can see them, you can use your reaction to reanimate them as a ghoul, which they will do at the start of your next turn. You may command these ghouls as if they were under the animate dead spell but with them dying after 1d4 rounds.
